  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void chooseDst​(java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDst, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> event)
    Small method to set the MouseClicked event handler for the effective possible destinations of move/build after the turn builder choice.
    private void createBuilder​(java.lang.String color, Coordinates cellCoord)
    This method creates a new builder and positions it in the right cell
    private int getBuilderIndexInStack​(Coordinates cellStackCoord)
    Returns the position(index) of the builder in the StackPane (cell)
    void modifyHeight​(Coordinates dstCoord, boolean buildDome)
    This method modifies the height of the destination cell and creates also a new building based on reached height placing it in the right destination.
    private void moveBuilder​(Coordinates src, Coordinates dst)
    MoveBuilder moves the builder in the chosen cell and removes any already present builder
    private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane newCell()
    Creates a new cell of the map (represented by the tilePane)
    private void removeBuilders​(Coordinates builder1Coord, Coordinates builder2Coord)
    Removes the builders from builder1Coord and builder2Coord if a player loses or if buildersPlacement was not successful
    void removePlayer​(java.lang.String nickname)
    Calls the private method removeBuilders to remove the player builders, then removes the builders cells from the occupiedCells.
    private void resetBuilder​(Coordinates builderCell)
    Resets old turn builder selection
    private void resetPossibleDestinations()
    Resets the possible destinations cells setting to null the mouse handlers and to TRANSPARENT the cells color
    void setChosenBuilderNum​(int chosenBuilderNumber)
    This override method sets the chosen number calling super() and resets the builder selection if the parameter is 0
    void setCurrClickCellHandler​(javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> handler)
    This method is used to set from Gui an handler for the mouse clicked event on cells
    void setOccupiedCells​(java.lang.String nickname, Coordinates builder1, Coordinates builder2)
    This override of setOccupiedCells allows to add one builder at a time and creates, with "create builder" method, a new builder or two new builders.
    void setPossibleDst​(java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder1, java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder2)
    Shows the possible destinations for a move or build, can be called before the builder choice or after.
    private void setPossibleDstCell​(int cellIndex)
    Makes possible destinations light up and makes them opaque when mouse enters
    void updateOccupiedCells​(java.lang.String nickname, Coordinates src, Coordinates dst)
    This override method calls the super() to update the occupied cells after a move/push event, then moves the builder calling the private method moveBuilder

  • Constructor Details

    • GuiMap

      GuiMap​(javafx.scene.layout.TilePane tilePane, javafx.scene.Scene primaryScene)
      This constructor sets the features of the tilePane and adds to it mapDimension x mapDimension StackPanes (Cells)
      Parameters:
      tilePane - root pane of the GuiClass
      primaryScene - scene in which the map is inserted

  • Method Details

    • setChosenBuilderNum

      public void setChosenBuilderNum​(int chosenBuilderNumber)
      This override method sets the chosen number calling super() and resets the builder selection if the parameter is 0
      Overrides:
      setChosenBuilderNum in class GameMap
      Parameters:
      chosenBuilderNumber - number of the chosen builder

    • setOccupiedCells

      public void setOccupiedCells​(java.lang.String nickname, Coordinates builder1, Coordinates builder2)
      This override of setOccupiedCells allows to add one builder at a time and creates, with "create builder" method, a new builder or two new builders. This is done if the player's builders haven't been positioned yet.
      Overrides:
      setOccupiedCells in class GameMap
      Parameters:
      nickname - player who owns the builders
      builder1 - first builder
      builder2 - second builder

    • setPossibleDst

      public void setPossibleDst​(java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder1, java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder2)
      Shows the possible destinations for a move or build, can be called before the builder choice or after. If the builder has been chosen, uses the attribute event to handle when a possibleDst is clicked.
      Overrides:
      setPossibleDst in class GameMap
      Parameters:
      possibleDstBuilder1 - Set of possible destinations for builder 1
      possibleDstBuilder2 - Set of possible destinations for builder 2

    • updateOccupiedCells

      public void updateOccupiedCells​(java.lang.String nickname, Coordinates src, Coordinates dst)
      This override method calls the super() to update the occupied cells after a move/push event, then moves the builder calling the private method moveBuilder
      Overrides:
      updateOccupiedCells in class GameMap
      Parameters:
      nickname - of the player who's moving/been moved
      src - old position of the builder
      dst - new position of the builder

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Calls the private method removeBuilders to remove the player builders, then removes the builders cells from the occupiedCells.
      Overrides:
      removePlayer in class GameMap
      Parameters:
      nickname - player who loss/whose builders placement was wrong

    • modifyHeight

      public void modifyHeight​(Coordinates dstCoord, boolean buildDome)
      This method modifies the height of the destination cell and creates also a new building based on reached height placing it in the right destination.
      Overrides:
      modifyHeight in class GameMap
      Parameters:
      dstCoord - coordinates of the destination of the build
      buildDome - this flag is true when a dome has to be built

    • setCurrClickCellHandler

      public void setCurrClickCellHandler​(javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> handler)
      This method is used to set from Gui an handler for the mouse clicked event on cells
      Parameters:
      handler - handles what will happen when a user clicks on a possible cell

    • newCell

      private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane newCell()
      Creates a new cell of the map (represented by the tilePane)
      Returns:
      the cell element (represented by a StackPane)

    • getBuilderIndexInStack

      private int getBuilderIndexInStack​(Coordinates cellStackCoord)
      Returns the position(index) of the builder in the StackPane (cell)
      Parameters:
      cellStackCoord - coordinates of the cell with the builder

    • createBuilder

      private void createBuilder​(java.lang.String color, Coordinates cellCoord)
      This method creates a new builder and positions it in the right cell
      Parameters:
      color - color of the builder owner
      cellCoord - where the new builder has to be put

    • resetBuilder

      private void resetBuilder​(Coordinates builderCell)
      Resets old turn builder selection
      Parameters:
      builderCell - the cell occupied by the last turn builder

    • moveBuilder

      private void moveBuilder​(Coordinates src, Coordinates dst)
      MoveBuilder moves the builder in the chosen cell and removes any already present builder
      Parameters:
      src - index of source of move step
      dst - index of the destination cell

    • setPossibleDstCell

      private void setPossibleDstCell​(int cellIndex)
      Makes possible destinations light up and makes them opaque when mouse enters
      Parameters:
      cellIndex - index of the possible destination cell

    • chooseDst

      private void chooseDst​(java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDst, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> event)
      Small method to set the MouseClicked event handler for the effective possible destinations of move/build after the turn builder choice.
      Parameters:
      possibleDst - set of possible destinations
      event - event handler to manage the choice

    • resetPossibleDestinations

      private void resetPossibleDestinations()
      Resets the possible destinations cells setting to null the mouse handlers and to TRANSPARENT the cells color

    • removeBuilders

      private void removeBuilders​(Coordinates builder1Coord, Coordinates builder2Coord)
      Removes the builders from builder1Coord and builder2Coord if a player loses or if buildersPlacement was not successful
